data.title: After Hours: Facebook Gets a Senate Hearing
data.text: The government want to scrutinize the upcoming Libra currency, among other things.

data.title: With Cryptocurrency Launch, Facebook Sets Its Path Toward Becoming an Independent Nation
data.text: With the launch of the Libra cryptocurrency, Mark Zuckerberg reveals his dreams of building a new virtual country, perhaps inspired by the Roman Empire.

data.title: Rep. Soto Expects Hearings on Facebook's Libra This Year
data.text: Rep. Darren Soto, a Florida Democrat and co-chairman of the Congressional Blockchain Caucus, comments on Facebook Inc.'s plans to create a new cryptocurrency called Libra. He speaks with Bloomberg's Joe Weisenthal, Taylor Riggs and Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?"

data.title: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg reiterates that her company needs to be regulated
data.text: No surprise, she wants Facebook to be involved in developing any rules that might affect it.

data.title: Facebook Claims Libra Offers Economic Empowerment to Billions – an Economist is Skeptical
data.text: Facebook claims its new cryptocurrency will bring financial inclusion and opportunity to billions, pushing cash further to the fringes. Is that a good thing?

data.title: BlockTower Capital's Bucella says Libra launch could spark crypto
data.text: Michael Bucella, Block Tower Capital Partners, on whether a bitcoin boom is just getting started.

data.title: Facebook's Sandberg Says Libra Coin Is 'Long Way From Launch'
data.text: Facebook Inc. Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said the company’s planned cryptocurrency coin, Libra, is a “long way from launch." She spoke to Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde at the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity in Cannes, France.

data.title: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency explained
data.text: Libra is like cash that lives inside your phone.

data.title: GOP congressman calls for hearing on Facebook cryptocurrency: 'We should be better informed'
data.text: Rep. Patrick McHenry has questions about Facebook's plan for a cryptocurrency, and he isn't alone.

data.title: Rep. Patrick McHenry calls for hearing on Facebook's cryptocurrency
data.text: Rep. Patrick McHenry (R-N.C.

data.title: Facebook investor on Libra cryptocurrency
data.text: Scott Kupor of Andreessen Horowitz joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss Facebook's new cryptocurrency.

data.title: Facebook called before Senate panel over digital currency project
data.text: Facebook Inc's plans to create a global cryptocurrency will face scrutiny from the U.S. Senate Banking Committee on July 16, the latest sign that policymakers around the globe are casting a wary eye on the project.

data.title: Tim Cook, Mark Zuckerberg make top CEO list for 7th year in a row     - CNET
data.text: Glassdoor unveils the results of its annual Employees’ Choice Awards. See how your boss did.

data.title: Senate banking committee sets July date to hold hearing on Facebook Libra coin
data.text: The Senate Banking committee on Wednesday set July 16 as the date to hold a hearing centered on Facebook Inc.

data.title: Facebook, Twitter and Google will testify to Congress on terrorist content
data.text: They'll also address misinformation to the House Homeland Security Committee.

data.title: Facebook content moderation is an ugly business. Here's who does it
data.text: Content moderators protect Facebook's 2.3 billion members. Who protects them?

data.title: Powell: Facebook discussed new cryptocurrency, Libra, with Fed
data.text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell discusses the Fed's decision to leave rates unchanged at a press conference following the announcement.

data.title: Facebook discussed the launch of its cryptocurrency with the Fed, Jerome Powell says
data.text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Wednesday that Facebook spoke to the central bank about the digital currency called Libra

data.title: Facebook's Big Win
data.text: The management team at Facebook just announced a significant win for the company: plans to dive into cryptocurrency and online transactions.

data.title: Trade Updates: Micron, Transocean, KWEB, Facebook & Snap
data.text: "Halftime Report" traders Jon and Pete Najarian on updates on how their "unusual" trades have performed.

data.title: Tech industry slams GOP senator’s bill that would hold companies liable for user-posted content
data.text: Republican Sen. Josh Hawley has proposed a bill that would remove immunity that protects tech companies like Facebook, Twitter and Google’s YouTube from liability for user-posted content, unless these companies proved to the FTC that their content moderation was politically neutral.

data.title: Why One Analyst Sees Significant Upside at Facebook in Crypto Endeavor
data.text: Although Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) had a rough run in 2018 amid security breaches, congressional hearings, and privacy issues, the company has done significantly better this year.

data.title: 5 Ways Facebook Can Profit From Its Cryptocurrency
data.text: The social networking giant and an investing group it is forming will launch stablecoin Libra in early 2020.

data.title: 'We're Not in the Market for Big Acquisitions' Says Facebook COO Sandberg
data.text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg says the company is not in the market to make any big acquisitions right now.

data.title: Facebook Needs to Explain Privacy Controls Better Says COO Sandberg
data.text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg says the company needs to do a better job of explaining privacy controls to users.

data.title: Facebook's Sandberg Says 'We Are Calling for More Regulation'
data.text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg says the social media giant is calling for more regulation and knows there is a need for it.

data.title: Facebook workers break NDA, expose grim working conditions
data.text: Casey Newton, 'The Verge' Silicon Valley editor, who broke the story on the working conditions for Facebook moderators, joins 'Squawk Alley' to discuss his story.

data.title: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg says the company needs to make it clearer how data privacy works
data.text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg gave comments at a conference in Cannes on Facebook's handling of user data and data privacy.

data.title: Calibra wallet won’t launch in Facebook’s biggest market
data.text: Facebook unveiled its audacious Libra cryptocurrency and Calibra digital wallet on Tuesday through which it plans to transform financial services across the globe. The social juggernaut made clear of its ambitions when it said that it wishes to empower more than 1.7 billion people around the world who currently do not have a bank account.

data.title: Facebook's Libra Cryptocurrency Is the Future of Fintech
data.text: Whereas it’s taken bitcoin years since its inception to break into the public consciousness, Facebook's Libra has the benefit of being made available on a massive social media platform that boasts as many as 2.4 billion users worldwide.

data.title: Key Words: Facebook is preparing for ‘the next stage’ of this financial meltdown, strategist says
data.text: Facebook on Tuesday finally revealed the details of Libra, its hotly anticipated entry into the crowded cryptocurrency space.

data.text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) officially announced its new Libra cryptocurrency, and a pair of Wall Street analysts weighed in on Libra’s impact on Wednesday.

data.title: New bill would make Facebook, Twitter liable for political bias
data.text: Big tech companies would have to subject themselves to an external audit to prove they're neutral.

data.title: Facebook content moderators break NDAs to expose shocking working conditions
data.text: A report from The Verge reveals new details about the appalling working conditions at Facebook's content moderation site in Tampa.

data.title: Stocks Turn Mixed Ahead Of Fed; Facebook's Libra Faces Federal Scrutiny
data.text:
Adobe topped the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100, while Boeing led the Dow Jones Industrial Average early Wednesday and markets awaited a Federal Reserve announcement.

data.title: Browsing LinkedIn and Instagram to Put Herself in Readers’ Shoes
data.text: People consume news in many ways, which is why Anna Dubenko’s job — editor of off-platform strategy — takes her to platforms where others go for a break from theirs.

data.title: If Facebook hits this level it's a 'straight shot' back to the highs, technical analyst says
data.text: Facebook is leading the FANG stocks this year, and Miller Tabak's Matt Maley foresees more upside.

data.title: Facebook's Cryptocurrency faces congressional backlash
data.text: Representatives Maxine Waters and Patrick McHenry of the House Finance Subcommittee want to scrutinize Facebook's new cryptocurrency.

data.title: Facebook's ambitious cryptocurrency plan greeted by wall of regulatory and data concerns
data.text: Global watchdogs and top U.S. Congress members are calling for oversight of a digital asset being launched by Facebook.

data.title: Libra currently looks more like a fiat currency than a cryptocurrency
data.text: Facebook unveiled a cryptocurrency called Libra yesterday as well as the Libra Association, a not-for-profit that will oversee all things Libra.

data.title: Facebook’s Libra coin could become a big pain in the wallet for consumers
data.text: Facebook’s FB, -0.29%  foray into cryptocurrency could mean trouble for consumers’ finances.

data.title: Regulators pour cold water on Facebook's cryptocurrency
data.text: CNBC's Elizabeth Schulze discusses talk of regulation over Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency.

data.title: Senator proposes bill that would blow up business models for Facebook, YouTube, other tech giants
data.text: Sen. Josh Hawley, a well-known tech critic, is introducing legislation that would remove the liability immunity big technology companies receive for user-posted content under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act (CDA) of 1996.
